intro: Aspidostemon trianthera, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its attractive, velvety leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub with upright stems and produces clusters of small, fragrant blooms. It prefers well-drained soil and bright, indirect light, making it a popular choice for indoor gardening. Its ornamental value has led to numerous cultivars being developed for horticultural use.
